title: LFO (without sync) changes speed based on song tempo
body: DAW tempo controls or offsets LFO RATE even with SYNC OFF. That can't be right.
author: Taronium

comments.body: Oh no really?

Yes, haha. Really!
Kind of a little shocker, because I love playing with LFO as oscillator. With Key Tracking to 25% it tracks perfectly. But then... Bamm!

That s embarrassing but i have fixed it in #248

good catch and wow very sorry about that
Awesome, Paul, no worries! You're doing a bang up job! ðŸ˜ŽðŸ‘

I tested tempo sync extensively when I added it
Just not in the off position 
lol

title: Unisono Position content not resetted...
body:
Using "nightly" (2025-02-07) on macOS (M1)

* Go to "Tune"
* Set Modulation to "Unisono Postion" with target "Coarse Tune" and some value (50%)
* Go to Settings Unisono and change the amount of voices and play some keys to check. Step up to 5 and back down to 1.
* Go back to "Tune" and take off the modulation. ("Unisono Position" on "Coarse Tune").
* Now play to verify. 
* Then go back to Settings Unisono and bring the voices back up and play a little. 

Seems like there is an unisono voice array, which may not get its content cleared properly. Suggestion would be to make sure you clear the respective array, if a modulation is being taken off! Go through all notes, too. 

By the way, the usual "Panic" trick to flush things out would not work on the above problem! Loading a different preset, however, works to clear the fields/arrays.
author: Taronium

comments.body: Thanks yeah I got several other reports they I got modulation wrong in the coarse mode and I think I know why. Iâ€™ll put this top of stack
Will be fixed in the next nightly, in about 30-40 minutes

title: Porta Modes only doing legato porta
body: I'm not sure if I'm missing something with the porta modes but I tried all three and none of them did portamento unless there were legato with overlapping note ons or they are in release. They all seem to work the identically. The menu looks great though!
author: kdulcet

comments.body:
So they only work In legato yes there is no poly

But also if no glide has started then thereâ€™s no glide to continue so without overlapping nots thereâ€™s no portamento to continue 

To see the difference set porta to 4 and go c3 c4 to start the glide, release, and the glide will continue when you press say d4 

Is what you want that if no glide is started then thereâ€™s next keypress starts from last released note? Thatâ€™s a totally different mode than what I coded but one I can add I guess

I think the behaviors are basically right. But indeed you need to begin a portamento with overlapping notes, which I feel quire sure is ust plain wrong. It feels hyper weird for me to play in any case. 

In the new modes every fresh voice start should do a porta from the last known pitch. What the last known pitch is depends on the mode. 
Mode 1 ignores prior pitch. 
Mode 2 keeps silently updating the prior pitch after the last voice has finished.
Mode 3 holds the pitch of the last voice when it ends.

Writing that also made me realize there's two options for the middle mode. 

4 seconds porta. 
Play C3 and then hold c4. 
Release after two seconds  
Then wait at least another two seconds. 
Then play C5. 

...do you porta from c4, or do you start at c5 directly? 
I think porta from c4. But I think you might say the other.

In any case I also think the naming could use some work. "Gated" and "released" are maybe not actually the right terms here since it's not actualloy about either of those (unless you take released to mean "main EG release has finished"). 

How about this. Call the param "behavior at voice end". And the options are:
Reset
Continue
Pause

I think that makes sense.

OK so I fixed this in my latest push. We have another issue open on it (the ports over release) so I'm going to close this one and we can use that one if theres other changes.

If what i pushed works for you both then i'll just remove the experimental label and voila

title: Keytrack off range
body:
> I want to do some proper PWM that doesn't change its rate dependent on the frequency of the note being played.
> Therefore I'd like to see one (or more) of the following features:
> - Fixed ratio offset in Hz
> - Fixed oscillator frequency tunable down below 7.72 Hz (ideally down to 0 Hz) for slow phase shifting
> - An LFO modulating an oscillator's phase leading to that oscillator's phase being shifted while it's sounding (not just the initial onset phase)

I responded

> Keytrack: You aren't the first person to want below 7hz. Right now the control has a semitone range of -70..70 with 0 being 440hz. Making this range -90 to 90 is a trivial change. Setting the frequency to hard 0 at -90 may be doable also.
author: baconpaul

comments.body:
Plan of attack

1. `patch.h`: Set the range to -80/80 with a custom min display of 0hz
2. `op_source.h`: in setBaseFrequency if the value is < -79.99 set the base frequency to zero

voila

@baconpaul For the use case that user wanted, the range 0...0.1 Hz is really important to have fine control over. You said the current min that results in the 7.72 hz floor is -70 right? 10 semitones down from there â‰ˆ4hz. Jumping from there to 0 isn't gonna cut it. 

If you bring the ratio down to -32 you can almost certainly get there, but having to divide the readouts dividing by 32 is not really great UX. 

Really, I think the best solution would be that with keytrack is turned off, the ratio control itself should become a frequency control, ideally fitting 0-100 hz in the first third of a turn or so. Not sure what the param meta data should be but spontaneously the semitone paradigm seems wrong in that case. Though it could work if we figure out how much negative range we actually need for your custom min display to work. 

Bit annoying streaming-wise obviously, but doable right?
Here I'm assuming the DSP can actually go to true zero. Maybe that's not true for all the resampler engines?

Right so that's harder indeed. I'll ponder best way to do it.

the dsp is all fine. It's really just the parameter.

title: Copy / Paste Envelopes (FR)
body:
Hi,

There are a _lot_ of envelopes : ) it would be really convenient if we could copy / paste the DAHDSR data via a right-click menu option, or small clipboard c/p buttons next to the envelope.

Just a thought.

Cheers
R.
author: RobU23

comments.body:
Thanks yeah I agree

This is a dup of #65 which I just pushed into the 1.1 milestone. It's a good idea

I'll probably put a hamburger menu on the bottom screen with copy envelope, copy lfo, copy modulation, copy operator type things.
Closed as dup. Thanks!

title: Resizing Options [Feature Request]
body:
On lower resolution screens (1440x900 in my case) the plugin is slightly too tall.
The CLAP version doesn't include a scrolling option so getting to the bottom of the plugin is a bit hard.

Thank you
author: Trace98J

comments.body: Oh I did this yesterday - resizing in the main menu under ui options
Oh thanks!

title: Modulatable envelope decay/release
body:
It would be useful to be able to modulate envelope decay and release times. To save mod assignments, it would be fine for me if decay and release would be modulatable together (like a modulatable decay+release factor). If I had to choose between both, I'd choose only the decay time.

- the modulation target should accept positive and negative modulation values
- popular use cases
  - key tracking to envelope decay (especially here the positive/negative mod values come into play) 
  - velocity to envelope decay
  - continuous (non-switch) sustain pedal to release time (this is not so essential and a bit more esoteric. Current sustain pedal behavior is very fine already)
author: Trinitou

comments.body:
I need to fix #35 before I do this

but yeah it is a good idea

title: Does RM with no depth really need to == silence?
body: It would be nicer if it didn't.
author: Andreya-Autumn

comments.body: Well, what else should x * 0 be?
This is fixed after long discord discussion

title: Accessibility: VoiceOver and NVDA cursor can't enter the interface
author: pitermach

comments.body:
I just tested Six-Sines 2025-01-06-0cd1549 under Mac OS 15.2 and Windows 10 with NVDA, both with Reaper and Standalone. So far, the accessibility in terms of the labels seems great, but there's a major problem actually getting to the UI.

Quickest way to reproduce on Mac is just either open the standalone app or add an FX instance in Reaper, then use CTRL+Option+arrows to try navigating to the different controls. What happens right now is VoiceOver, and NVDA on Windows if you use its advanced navigation commands, completely skips over the interface as if it wasn't there. If you click inside the plugin, then start tabbing, then the screen readers due announce the control you're on, but VoiceOver doesn't want to follow the keyboard focus like it normally does.

OK a new nightly in about 15-20 minutes will fix this.

I had accesible and keyboard capable tagged incorrectly at some very-top-of-heirarchy housing components, basically.

Excellent bug report. Thank you.

title: An operator can also be noise source
body:
Operator is noise source
Ratio is noise color perhaps if we use the correlated noise? that would work.
And we ignore base frequency altogether
author: baconpaul

comments.body: We could just ignore base frequency. Or we could try to get my colour thing from SC in. But as you pointed out that's a lot of ops at this sample ratre. Will have to be optimized somehow to be useful here I guess.
The 10x feedback and stable resample obviates this
